result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen W Bowden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

--Mr. Bowden is to notify child support of new employment**

[MA]Case called at 2:18pm 
Defendant Stephen W Bowden appears via telephone.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Joe Brewster appears. Representative of the Child Support Agency, Ms. Stolar appears.

Ms. Stolar updates the Court as to current payments made and balance due.
Agent Brewster indicates that DOC has not issued a warrant pending outcome of todays hearing
Agent Brewster requests an extension of probation
Statement made by Mr. Bowden

The Court questions of Mr. Bowden 

The Court extends Mr. Bowden Probation for 1 year
The Court orders Mr. Bowden to make child support payments of $304 as a condition of probation, and make payments towards arrearages
Mr. Bowden is to notify child support of new employment
The Court encourages Mr. Bowden to obtain employment

recess: 2:30pm

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 2:56pn [mo]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Stephen W Bowden in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--the Court authorize transfer of this Probation term to Georgia
--to pay $400 per month towards child support and arrearages
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay $108 in subpoena fees
--DNA sample upon demand

The Court orders that child support and arrearages are to be paid prior to costs/fees.


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 3:15pm
Sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 02:30 pm
With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:47 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Stephen W Bowden in court with Attorney Robert Franklin Nagel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ presents recommendations to the Court if the charges remain felonies at time of sentencing; informs the Court of alternate offer of amending counts #1, #2, and #3 to misdemeanors if ALL outstanding child support is paid PRIOR to the sentencing date. The State would then be willing for the Defendant to withdraw his pleas and then offer an alternate offer of a fine only.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #3, #4 & #5
Recess: 2:02 pm

NEXT: Schedule Sentencing Hearing 10/30/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices

Case called at 4:04pm [mo]
Defendant Stephen W Bowden in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--The Defense stands mute, the Court enters a "not guilty" plea on behalf

Upon inquiry from the Court, the State confirms that Mr. Bowden has not had any bond violations.
Atty. Nagel requests that the case be set for FSSC and Jury Trial due to lack of resolution at this time. 
The Court and Atty. Nagel discuss scheduling of the hearings due to Mr. Bowden's out of state residence
